epiſcopus ſemper poſterum à synodo propria debeat conſecrari c ad eboricum vero civitatem te volumus epiſcopum mittere quem ipſe judicaveris ordinare ita duntaxat ut ſi eadem civitas cum finitimis locis verhum dei receperit ipſe quoque 12 epiſcopos ordinet metropolitani honore fruatur quem tamen tuae fraternitatis volumus diſpoſitioni ſubjacere poſt obitum vero tuum ita epiſcopus quos ordinaverit praeſit ut lundonienſis epiſcopi nullo modo ditioni ſubjaceat sit vero inter lundoni eboricae civitatis epiſcopos poſterum honoris iſta diſtinctio ut ipſe prior habeatur qui prius fuerit conſiſteth eccleſiaſtical order nothing holy order superiours inferiours francis forrier dominican portugal ſame time ſaid hierarchy conſiſteth juriſdiction council nice placeth ſpeaketh biſhop rome ordained biſhops reſides power conſecration may ſufficient warrant digreſſion conſecration refers perſons done per impoſitionem manuum except virgin alſo pontifical law conſecrable creature though fooliſh virgin yea though polluted virgin provided per ſpontaneam voluntariam pollutionem putativa virginitas caſe ſhall laureolam virginitatis alſo velum conſecrationis call cajetan sum v virgin conſecrat leſſ de jur lib 4 c 2 dub 16 alii dd conſecration refers thing church chappels bell thing like ſound done per preces together conſecrationceremonies epiſcopal order therein concurring ſo likewiſe conſecration virgin per preces together ceremony uſed conſecration virgin cujus signum eſt quod pontificali romano ubi de hac conſecratione agitur non dicatur roganda de aliqua contaminatione ſed de vita conſcientia carnis integritate ut notat cajetanus leſſ ubi ſup next view dean chapter ſome proſpect dean chapter ſeems former time certain dean uſurped authority beyond dignity function took upon exerciſe epiſcopal juriſdiction theſe condemnd council lateran pope alexander fifth canon council theſe word viz quoniam quidam quibuſdam partibus ſub pretio ſtatuuntur qui decani vocantur pro certa pecuniae quantitate epiſcopalem jurisdictionem exercent praeſenti decreto statuimus ut qui de caetero id praeſumpſerit officio ſuo privetur epiſcopus conferendi hoc officium poteſtatem inſolence grown quite practice day eleventh canon word illud etiam de vicariis qui perſonis fide juramento obligato ſunt duximus ſtatuendum quod ſi fide vel sacramenti religione contempta perſonatum ſibi falſo aſſumentes contra perſonas ſe erexerint ſi ſuper hoc jure vel confeſſi vel convicti fuerint de caetero eodem epiſcopatu ad officii ſui executionem non admitta • tur appropriation church ever ought eſtabliſhment ſufficient maintenance vicar succeſſors pro ſuſtentatione ſua congrua made biſhop dioceſs conſent ſuch ſuch church appropriated though moſt part conſiſting minute tithe yet hath denomination benefice eccleſiaſtical benefice properly rectory parſonage whatever perpetual vicar vicarage benefice fee though properly demeſne fee temporal inheritance therefore word beneficium feudiſts canoniſts ſame feodum feudum common lawyer yet ſometimes oppoſed call allodium man hath name proper right abſolutely underſtood beneficium may poſſeſsd nomine alieno certis ſub legibus may properly ſaid allodium properly man doth poſſeſs nomine proprio abſolute inſtance grant made king william rufus anſelme archbiſhop canterbury praecepit rex ut inveſtiretur anſelmus omnibus ad archiepiſcopatum pertinentibus atque ut civitas cantuariae quam lanfrancus ſuo tempore beneficio à rege tenebat abbatia sancti albani quam non ſolum lanfrancus ſed anteceſſores ejus habuiſſe noſcuntur allodium eccleſiae chriſti cantuarienſis pro redemptione animae ſuae perpetuo jure tranſirent ninth canon lateran council pope alexander prohibited grant promiſe eccleſiaſtical benefice actually void reaſon canon prevent deſire death preſent incumbent ſuch promiſe grant expectation ſucceed benefice next place follows chapter advowſons advowſons canon law call jus patronatus power right preſenting one inſtituted vacant eccleſiaſtical benefice ſay vacant becauſe benefice void preſentation void law reaſon becauſe otherwiſe occaſion might thereby given preſented deſire wiſh incumbent death cap nulla de conceſſ praebend although call advowſon canon law call jus patronatus yet every jus patronatus advowſon according civil law jus patronatus hath twofold acceptation law one right lord patron bondman made free manumiſſion ſo taken ff de jur patron preſent purpoſe right preſentation eccleſiaſtical benefice belongs patron benefice church law likewiſe called jus advocationis appears cap quia clerici de jur patronat advowſon intended right advowſons jus patronatus law doth alſo diſtinguiſh eccleſiaſtical laical touching eccleſiaſtical vid covarru qq pract c 36 n • 2 ſo called becauſe eccleſiaſtick doth enjoy poſſeſs ſo may alſo poſſeſs laick patronage becauſe belongs one hath founded built endowed church ex bonis eccleſiasticis reaſon ſome rectory church ſome eccleſiaſtical dignity benefice erected money gotten ex bonis eccleſiaſticis caſe hath jus patronatus eccleſiaſtici patronatum eccleſiaſticum ſo one hath advowſon right preſentation becauſe biſhop dean like alſo jus patronatus eccleſiaſtici ſo gloſs clem 2 de jur patronat alii kind advowſons jus patronatus laici ſo called belongs one becauſe hath either founded built endowed ſome church erected ſome benefice ex willielmus c ex quae omnipotens deus ſua gratia mihi largiri est dignatus quaedam concedo eccleſiae auguſtini anglorum apoſtoli c pro ſalute animae meae parentum meorum predeceſſorum succeſſorum haereditario jure haec ſunt eccleſiae decimae duarum manſionum viz feverſham middleton ex omnibus redditibus qui c omnibus ibidem appendentibus terra ſylva pratis aqua c haec omnia ex integro concedo auguſtino abbati fratribus ut habeant teneant poſſideant perpetuum afterward confirmed pope alexander third ratified theobald archbiſhop canterbury together eſtabliſhment ordination vicarage ſaid temporal perpetual commendams canon law great uſe u indeed church rome according former mode commendams vacant church commended either authority pope cathedral ca penult ult 21 q 1 authority biſhop church parochial commonly temporal six month utilitatem eccleſiae commonly perpetual magi ſubventionem eorum quibus commendantur quam ipſarum eccleſiarum commendatary life ſame reality titular theſe commendams original inſtituted good purpoſe uſed evil end reaſon war peſtilence like election proviſion could made ſo ſoon otherwiſe might superiour recommend vacant church ſome honeſt worthy perſon govern beſides care rector provided nothing revenue govern conſign another proceſs time theſe commendataries pretence neceſſity made uſe fruit enjoy longer ſought mean hinder proviſion remdy whereof order taken commenda ſhould continue longer six month pope plenitude power exceed theſe limit commended longer time laſt life commendatary giving power uſe fruit eccleſiaſtical benefice happen void lapſe law provides ſhall ſeaſonably ſupplied meet incumbent mean admit long vacancy hath therefore ſet competent time within hath original right preſentation ſhall diſcharge duty therein lapſe ſhall incurr law ab inferiori ad superiorem gradually devolves matter lapſe intent purpoſe thereof though denomination ancient ninth canon council lateran pope alexander provided cum praebendas eccleſias ſeu quaelibet officia aliqua eccleſia vacare contigerit vel ſi etiam modo vacant non diu maneant ſuſpenſo ſed sex menſes perſonis quae digne adminiſtrare valeant conferantur si autem epiſcopus ubi ad eum ſpectaverit conferre diſtulerit per capitulum ordinetur quod ſi ad capitulum electio pertinuerit infra praeſcriptum terminum hoc non fecerit epiſcopus exequatur aut ſi forte omnes neglexerint metropolitanus de ipſis abſque illorum contradictione diſponat vid chron gervaſii de temp h 2 eighth canon conſtitution council rome year 1180 pope alexander third ordained eccleſiastical office ſhould promiſed man became vacant deceaſe poſſeſſor ſays canon unrighteous thing put man expectation another man living whereby may wiſh brother death place ſhall happen vacant let planted within six month elſe hath right plantation ſhall loſe time chapter metropolitan biſhop ſhall power provide vacant place according canon law laypatron hath four month preſent benefice eccleſiaſtical patron hath benefice time pleaſes papae vero non eſt aliquod tempus praefixum cum non habet superiorem qui poſſit ejus negligentiam ſupplere c aliorum 9 q 3 niſi c statutum de praeb 6 although regularly inferiour dignity eccleſiaſtical benefice ought beſtowed within six month vacancy according rule canon law c cum noſtris c dilectus c poſtulaſtis yet greater dignity law conferrd within three month majores vero dignitates ut epiſcopales debent intra tres menſes tribui c ne pro defectu de elect c poſtquam 50 dist although ſtrictneſs propriety speechcollation preſentation preſentation referrs laypatron collation biſhop yet canon law word collation collator frequently uſed ſenſe promiſcuouſly relating therefore one place ſaid praeſentatio à fundatore fieri ſolet epiſcopo vel alteri collatori reſignant gloſſ 14 nu 6 post barba c abbatem de reſcript col pen yea ſometimes collation generally taken alſo inſtitution per tex ca uno ut eccleſiaſt benefic ſine diminut conferant although layman doth found build endow church yet canon law allowes priviledge jus patronatus jus praeſentandi otherwiſe ex gratia canonist hold de rigore juris non poteſt laicus eccleſiaſtica tractare negotia c 2 de judic ſay pope encourage founding building endowing church reſerved priviledge confirmed law—c decernimus 16 q 7 per tot tit de jur patronat jus patronatus ſo preſentation alſo canon law twofold one ſeu beneficii quod poſſidet c dilectus de offic leg c cum dilectus de jure patro lay patron hath jus patronatus ratione ſui patrimonii hath four month aforeſaid ad praeſentandum c uno yet preſentation may variare may ſemel tantum c quod autem de jure patr cumulative non autem ut à primo recedere omnino poſſit c cum autem ubi pan ibid likewiſe collation alſo twofold ſame law viz neceſſary voluntary requiresexamination admiſſion examination ſhall ever precede ordination admiſſion inſtitution induction although incumbent biſhop ordinary order benefice six month expire yet obligation lie upon effect ſo ſoon party offer ſubmiſſion examination ſpecially ſame time ordinary circa curam paſtoralem examination referrs due qualification perſon ordained beneficed ability converſation examination requires ſhould incumbent mendicant fifth canon conſtitution made great convention leſs one hundred eighty biſhops rome pope alexander third ordained biſhop ſhould admit man presbyter deacon without deprived benefice reaſon either ſome crime committed another benefice incompatible accepted anſwer canoniſts make word ipſo jure privatus beneficio offender doth immediately loſe title benefice inſomuch longer dominus beneficii yet doth retain poſſeſſion thereof cannot deprived niſi cauſa cognita without fair trial law gloſſ c licet epiſcopus 28 de praebendis 6 dd ibi note ſaid way interpretation theſe word ipſo jure statute law realm way expoſition thereof among canoniſts although clergy ever higheſt repute prince people plurality goſpel hath received honoured diver priviledges immunity laity yet law hath ever held prejudicial church plures honores eccleſiaſtici uni perſonae ſint tribuendi council convend weſtminster five twentieth year reign h 1 five hundred year ſince honorius 2 pope synod ordained theſe word praecipimus ne uni perſonae eccleſia archidiaconatus aut diverſi tribuantur honores purpoſe third canon lateran council pope alex quia nonnulli diverſas eccleſiaſticas dignitates plures eccleſias parochiales contra sacrorum canonum inſtituta nituntur adquirere ita ut cum unum officium vix implere ſufficiant ſtipendia ſibi vendicent plurimorum ne id de caetero fiat diſtrictius inhibemus et quia tantum quorundam proceſſit ambitio ut non duas vel tres ſed sex vel plures eccleſias perhibeantur habere nec duabus poſſunt debitam proviſionem impendere per fratres coepiſcopos noſtros hoc emendari praecipimus likewiſe gregory tenth ſucceeded clement council lyon pluralitatem beneficiorum curatorum damnavit hen de knyghton de event angl lib 2 like manner appears fourteenth canon council rome pope alexander 3 1180 plurality benefice forbidden vice ſmelling avarice ambition dangerous prejudicial people whoſe soul neglected ſuch paſtours one chiefeſt reaſons law forbids plurality becauſe enjoyns reſidence inconſiſtent ſame incumbent aquinas ſays two benefice intrinſecally evil malum ſe altogether indifferent carry ſpecies evil yet ſo upon due circumstance may capable qualified lawfulneſs aquin quodlib 9 art 15 many inconveniencies law doth ſpecifically obſerve follow upon plurality may impertinently added thereby pious intention founder fruſtrated council trent hath theſe word haec pluralitas est perverſio totius ordinis eccleſiaſtici concil trid seſſ 24 cap 17 pope alexander third ſaid pluralitas beneficiorum certum continet dignity parſonages simple cure vacant six month begin firſt day poſſeſſion power convert profit thereof uſe way whereby eccleſiaſtical benefice may acquireddeprivation many cauſes eccleſiaſtical perſon may thereof deprived many generally may reduced theſe three head 1 diſpoſition law 2 sentence judge 3 free voluntary reſignation though properly deprivation yet amiſſion benefiee deprivation diſpoſition law either reaſon ſome crime whereunto penalty deprivation ipſo facto law annexed reaſon accepting another benefice incompatible pontifical law add two concern u viz ingreſs religion matrimony crime incurr deprivation many muſt proved beneficed party bound ſponte ſua quit benefice ante sententiam judicis leſſ de benefic cap 29 dub 8 man jure privatus privandus caſe benefice cannot beſtowed another unleſs privative sentence firſt pronounced judge perſon beneficed long abſent nonreſident benefice benefice reaſon ſuch long abſence void ipſo jure law caſe alſo requires judicial sentence deprivation post trinae citationis eorum eccleſiis publice edictum gloſſ c quoniam ut lite non conteſtata c one chiefeſt reaſons law plurality prohibited reſidence prevention nonreſidence appears third canon lateran council canon prohibits diver eccleſiaſtical dignity parochial church one make proviſion againſt nonreſidence theſe word viz cum igitur vel eccleſia vel eccleſiaſticum miniſterium committi debuerit talis ad hoc perſona quaeratur quae reſidere loco curam ejus per ſeipſum valeat exercere quod ſi aliter actum fuerit qui receperit quod contra sacros canones acceperit amittat qui dederit largiendi poteſtate privetur likewiſe thirteenth canon great council one hundred eighty biſhops aſſembled rome pope alexander third year lord 1180 ordained ſuch perſons ſhould preferrd eccleſiastical dignity ſhall actually reſident people undertake cure soul work miniſtry perſons otherwiſe deprive office benefice conferred conferr without theſe condition let loſe right conferring office benefice appears ſtrict exact law againſt nonreſidence romiſh church one moſt famous abbot monaſteries britain ancientlyabbots abbies ſeems bangor flintſhire whereof ranulphus ceſtrenſis ſays tradunt nonnulli pelagium fuiſſe abbatem apud famoſum illud monaſterium de bangorceſtrenſ polychron l 4 c 31 monaſtery ranulphus ſpeaks beda called bamornabyrig lingua anglorum quo ſays tantus fertur fuiſſe numerus monachorum ut cum septem portiones eſſet cum praepoſitis ſibi rectoribus monaſterium diviſum nulla harum portio minus quam trecentos homines haberet qui omnes de labore manuum ſuarum vivere ſolebant bed eccl hiſt lib 2 c 2 concerning abbot nothing u alſo well known kingdom pope doth exerciſe juriſdiction may ſuffice obſerve word abbates hath anciently wide far different ſignification commonly underſtand thereby among law king aethelſtan find word quatuor abbates taken according gloſſographiſt thereon quatuor hebdomadas law directs manner hundred court ſhall held word hoc eſt judicium qualiter hundredum teneri debeat primis ut conveniant ſemper ad quatuor abbates faciat omnis homo rectum alii hiſt angl scrip antiq col 847 gloſſary call locum plane mendoſum quatuor abbates quatuor hebdomadas underſtood probable appears one law king edward father ſaid aethelſtan began reign 901 son king alured word law volo ut omnis praepoſitus habeat gemotum ſemper ad quatuor ebdomodas efficiat ut omnis homo rectum habeat omne placitum capiat terminum quando perveniat ad finem ibid col 837 word gemotum place meant conventus publicus concilium chiefly placitum appears 107th law king kanute made indemnity ſuch ſhould recourſe tribunal ſafe coming going court juſtice et volo ut omnis homo pacem habeat eundo ad gemotumquam varia ſint gemotorum genus vid equit doct ſuo gloſſario vel rediens de gemoto id eſt placito nifi fit fur probatus word saxon 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 convenire unde noſtratium meet digreſſion reader muſt put abbot ſcore regard word abbates gave occaſion thereof may venial offence regard eccleſiaſtical dignity u laid aſide though poſſeſſions better fortune yet king h 8 diſſolve augment number colledges revenue thereof alſo elizabeth converted collegiate church chapter mention alſo made chauntries cantaria pleaſe aedes sacrum ideo inſtituta dotata praediis ut miſſa ibidem cantaretur pro anima fundatoris propinquorum ejus aethelwolphus rex decimam totius regni ſui partem ab omni regali ſervitio tributo liberavit ſempiterno graphio cruce chriſti c uni trino deo immolavit simeon dunelm hiſt de geſt reg angl likewiſe aethelſtan reigned 70 year aethelwolfe firſt law made ſpecial proviſion punctual payment tithe ego adelſtanus rex c mando praepoſitis mei omnibus regno meo c ut primis reddant de meo proprio decimas deo tam vivente captali quam mortuis frugibus terrae epiſcopi mei ſimiliter faciant de ſuo proprio aldermanni mei praepoſiti mei et volo ut epiſcopi praepoſiti hoc judicent omnibus qui eis parere debent c recolendum quoque nobis eſt quam terribiliter libris poſitum eſt si decimam dare nolumus ut auferantur à nobis novem partes ſolummodo decima relinquatur aethelstan dying without iſſue ſucceeded kingdom brother edmond second whoſe law find thus enacted great synod convend london odo wolſtan archbiſhops preſent decimas praecipimus omni christiano ſuper chriſtianitatem ſuam dare c si quis hoc dare noluerit excommunicatus ſit firſt king edgar law theſe word reddatur omnis decimatio ad matrem eccleſiam cui parochia adjacet alſo fourth king ethelred law commanded theſe word praecipimus ut omnis homo c det rectam decimam ſuam ſicut diebus anteceſſorum noſtrorum fecit quando melius fecit hoc eſt ſicut aratrum peragrabit decimam acram et omnis conſuetudo reddatur ad matrem noſtram eccleſiam cui adjacet et nemo auferat deo quod ad deum pertinet praedeceſſores noſtri conceſſerunt ninth king alureds law si quis decimam contra teneat reddat lashlite cum dacis daeis pro danis laſhlite h e muleta quinque marcaruma wita je mulcta 30 solidorum secundum gloſſar hiſt angle seriptores decem witam cum anglis law conquerour particularly ordained de omni annona decima garba deo debita eſt ideo reddenda si gregem equarum habuerit pullum reddat decimum qui unam tamen vel duas habuerit de ſingulis pullis singulos denarios similiter qui vaccas plures habuerit decimum vitulum qui unam vel duas de vitulis ſingulis obolos ſingulos et qui caſeum fecerit det deo decimum ſi vero non fecerit lac decima die similiter decimum agnum decimum vellus decimum caſeum decimum butyrum decimum porcellum item de apibus vero similiter commodi quinetiam de boſco prato aquis de molendinis parcis vivariis piſcariis virgultis hortis negotionibus de omnibus rebus quas dederit deus decima par ei reddenda eſt qui novem partes ſimul cum decem largitur qui eam detinuerint per juſtitiam epiſcopi regis ſi neceſſe fuerit ad redditionem arguantur good ground canoniſts hold tithe originally ex defamed contumelia party preſent vel abſenti tanquam praeſenti prrſence ſuch relative repreſentation perſon contumeliouſly ſo reproached touching action defamation two queſtions raiſed rather caſuiſts canoniſts one whether heir defamer obliged make reſtitution dammage defamed caſe defamer died ſatiſfaction made whether ſatisfaction dammage done defamation made heir defamed caſe died ſuch dammages recovered although theſe queſtions anſwered negative known rule law actio perſonalis moritur cum perſona reaſon becauſe obligation ariſing thence meerly perſonal non est ad aliquid dandum ſed ad aliquid agendum yet navar adria • others hold contrary ſo anſwered though agree rule law yet deny foreſaid reaſon rule hold caſe ſay obligation caſe purely meerly perſonal commonly ſuppoſed doth tranſcripſit rex canutus malmsburius aetheldredo regi non epiſcopis tribuit peer realm per synodum landavenſem unexcommunicable circa 560 niſi prius conſulto rege aut ejus praecepto plain demonſtration king england anciently supremacy ſuperintendent eccleſiaſtical power juriſdiction inherent themſelves excluſively either home forreign power whatever 9 good authority aſſerted king supream himſelf inſtead whole law yea law ſelf chief interpreter thereof whoſe breaſt reſides whole knowledge ſame majeſty communicating authority judge expound law doth thereby abdicate ſame himſelf may aſſume unto oft pleaſes dr ridl view p 2 c 1 sect 7 conſonant whereunto borellus hath principum placita legis habent vigorem eatenus vim legis obtinebunt quatenus fuerint cum honeſtate conjuncta uſually taken hath ordinary juriſdiction cauſes eccleſiaſtical vid broc hoc tit immediate king common underſtanding biſhop dioceſs superviſor moſt part viſitor church within dioceſs hath ordinary juriſdiction cauſes aforeſaid juſtice within dioceſs jure proprio non per deputationem therefore care ſee church provided able curate habet enim curam curarum may execute law church eccleſiaſtical cenſures alone made preſentations church vacant within dioceſs ordinarius habet locum principaliter epiſcopo aliis superioribus qui ſoli ſunt ʋniverſales ſuis juriſdictionibus ſed ſunt ſub eo alii clerk come firſt yet may quit himſelf diſturbance becauſe doth nothing therein ordinary law two preſent ſo title become litigious ſuch caſe cannot receive clerk any▪ pleaſure except title certain hath way ſafety jure patronatus hath uſed jure patronatus find one party yet may ſtill receive contrary clerk lett muſt peril double peril 1 title better 2 patron whoſe clerk hath received plead defend title otherwiſe cannot though inqueſt jure patronatus ordinary may accept contrary clerk yet againſt juſtice intent law ſince proviſion meerly good ſafety ordinary pretend doubt therefore put patron enquiry charge delay ſatisfie ſecure ought judge receive clerk according verdict true meaning book ſay ordinary judge better title prejudge ſecundum allegata probata upon verdict right given found electionis epiſcopalis confirmatio poſtulatur inter caetera ſuper quibus inquiſitio examinatio praecedere debet secundum canonum inſtituta ot • • de confirm epiſt cap▪ unic illud exactiſſime inquiratur utrum plura beneficia cum animarum cura qui electus eſt antequam eligeretur habuerit et ſi habuiſſe inveniatur cum eo ſuper hoc fuerit diſpenſatum et diſpenſatio ſi quam exhibuerit vera ſit ad omnia beneficia quae obtinuit extendatur et ſi aliquo praemiſſorum ad quem confirmatio ſpectat electam deficere ſua diſcuſſione compererit eidem nullatenus munus confirmationis impendat 4 alſo c 2 〈◊〉 conceſſ pr •• bend sect 1 de regia n • • na pet rebuſſ reſponſ 14 biſhoprick void quomodocunque whether ceſſion otherwiſe law ſpeaks indefinitely caſe king ſhall nominate france ſhall new biſhop muſt nominate within six nine month elapſed nomination cannot afterwards nominate nam jus ſit ad papam dev • lutum nec poterit purgare moram gloſſ dict cap 2 de conceſſ praebend • law caſe kingdom nominatione non facta intra sex menſes devolvitur nominatio plenum diſpoſitio epiſcopatus ad papam alſo appears remarkable caſe controverted touching confirmation election ad epiſcopatum appamiarum upon death cardinal de albret 1520 10 dec biſhoprick became void whereupon canon church convened proceeded election new biſhop choſe bernard de lordat elected applied himſelf archiepiſcopo tholoſano tanquam ſuo metropolitano ſaltem vicariis ſuis confirmation election done accordingly confirmation procurator regius called appealed ſaid election confirmation alledging nomination biſhoprick belonged king nominated john de puis pope whereupon pope granted ſaid biſhoprick ſaid john de puis bull proxy pope took poſſeſſion thereof appeal afterwards supremam curiam de 〈◊〉 lordat de ſhillings nomine cathedratici extr de offic jud ordin c conquerent gl ibid ver duo ſolidos penſion paid biſhop à qualibet eccleſia ſecundum locus conſuetudinem panormitan upon text abb c conquerent de guilielm conqueſtor de denariis petri ſeu vectigali romano viz liber homo qui habuerit averia campeſtria 30 denariis aeſtimanda dabit denarium petri pro 4 denariis quos donaverit dominus quieti erunt qui anglia manent quod epiſcopales leges quae non bene nec ſecundum sanctorum canonum praecepta uſque ad mea tempora regno anglorum fuerunt communi concilio concilio archiepiſcoporum meorum caeterorum epiſcoporum abbatum omnium principum regni mei emendandas judicavi propterea mando regia authoritate praecipio ut nullus epiſcopus vel archidiaconus de legibus epiſcopalibus amplius hundretto turno ita co ubi ſup placita teneant nec cauſam quae ad regimen animarum pertinet ad judicium secularium hominum adducant ſed quicunque ſecundum epiſcopales leges de quacunque cauſa vel culpa interpellatus fuerit ad locum quem ad hoc epiſcopus elegerit nominaverit veniat ibique de cauſa ſua reſpondeat non ſecundum hundrettum intended hund • ed court theſe time sheriff h • ld tourn • per h •• dreda ita co ubi ſ • pr vid mag chart cap 35 expoſi • co thereon ſed ſecundum canones epiſcopales leges rectum deo epiſcopo ſuo faciat si vero aliquis per ſuperbiam elatus ad juſtitiam epiſcopalem venire non voluerit vocetur ſemel ſecundo tertio quod ſi nec ſic ad emendationem venerit excommunicetur ſi opus fuerit ad hoc vindicand fortitudo juſtitia regis vel vicecomitis adhibeatur ille autem qui vocatus ad juſtitiam epiſcopi venire noluit pro unaquaque vocatione legem epiſcopalem emendabit hoc etiam defendo mea authoritate interdico ne ullus vicecom aut praepoſitus aut miniſter regis nec aliquis laicus homo de legibus quae ad epiſcopum pertinent ſe intromittat nec aliquis laicus homo alium hominem ſine juſtitia epiſcopi ad judicium adducat judicium vero nullo loco portetur niſi epiſcopali sede aut illo loco quem ad hoc epiſcopus conſtituerit 8 confirmation charter sir ed coke foreſaid part inſtitutes refers u regiſter biſhop london willielmus dei gratia rex anglorum r bainardo de magna angliae liberae ſint perpetuum electiones quorumcunque praelatorum majorum minorum salva nobis haeredibus noſtris cuſtodia eccleſiarum monaſteriorum vacantium quae ad no pertinent promittimus etiam quod nec impediemus nec impediri permittemus per miniſtros noſtros nec procurabimus quin univerſis ſingulis monaſteriis eccleſiis poſtquam vacuerint praelatur •• quemcunque voluerint libere ſibi brought treſpaſs queſtion whether reſignation donative could donor might departed reſolved 1 donative begun foundation erection donor hath ſole viſitation ordinary hath nothing therewith parſon come donor ſo may reſtore although preſentee hath freehold yet may reveſt reſignation without ceremony ordinary hath nothing admiſſion inſtitution neceſſary caſe donative 2 reſolved reſignation one party good doth enure surrender ſhall 3 reſolved although reſignation de eccleſia yet ſhall extend poſſeſſions 15 synod 44 ed 3 canon made parſon every church england ſhall appoint pariſhclerk another synod advocatio eccleſiae either becauſe patron thereof claiming j • patronatus therein advocat ſe right unto ſame eamque eſſe ſui quaſi clientis loco rather becauſe patron right advocat alium church vacant preſents unto loco alterius veluti defuncti ske • • verb sig thence called ſometimes patron ſometimes advocati originally obtained right preſent church either founder builder benefactor ſame decretal c 4 24 de jure patronat plow 495 dy 48 co 1 102 4 37 6 39 litt 119 120 patronum faciunt do aedificatio fundus although advowſons temporal inheritance grantable deed ſo reſpect cognizable common law yet inaſmuch ſame canon law call jus patronatus cannot denied within eccleſiaſtical juriſdiction therefore although patron may action againſt ordinary temporal court quare impedit rejecting clerk yet ordinary may decree proceſs de jure patronatus caſe enquire mixt jury eccleſiaſtical layman touching ſaid advowſon right patronage according law cuſtomes church 2 uſual difference taken advocatio medietatis eccleſiae medietas advocationis eccleſiae former two patron every right preſent ſeveral incumbent biſhop admitted one ſame church diver may ſeveral parſons cure soul one pariſh ſuch advowſon alike every theſe patron every preſentments moity ſame church therefore called advocatio medietatis eccleſiae caſe may advocatio tertiae partis eccleſiae like latter viz medietas advocationis eccleſiae partition parceners although advowſon entire amongſt yet diſturbed preſent turn ſhall writ medietate tertia quarta parte advocationis eccleſiae caſe is▪ difference taken obſerved writ right altogether grounded upon right patronage quare impedit recover dammages ſuch diverſity conſidered writ general praeſentare ad eccleſiam doderidge advowſons lect 4 advowſons two ſorts one groſs sole original patron right point advowſons ſays jus honorificum oneroſum utile belonging church dioceſans conſent hath founded built endowed church hath given piece ground▪ c nobis c de jur patronat erected church thereon 16 q 7 c monaſterium endowed c piae mentis ibid therefore qualified right patronage indeed dioceſans conſent herein ſo requiſite canon law ſeems ſcarce feazable man patron 1 eliz crown archbiſhop canterbury commiſſaries c heretofore pope uſurpation realm ſo de jure ex regali authoritate may king grant unto conſecrated biſhop diſpenſation recipere obtinere beneficium cum cura animarum hold ſame commendam co par 4 75 holland caſe 3 caſe colt glover againſt biſhop coventry lichfield according sir hen hobart lord chief juſtice canon commendams ſaid three degree one semeſtris another perpetua vel ad vitam third intermedia diuturna ſed limitata ſometimes called temporaria temporalis vel ad certum temporis ſpatium limitata clem v extra l 3 de praebendis c 2 commenda semeſtris ariſe natural equity time patron reſpite given preſent church ſhould without proviſional paſtor law neceſſity agreeable law nature lapſe juſtly incurred commendam ceaſe ordinary may collate commenda perpetua vel ad vitam cannot leſs time life commendatary abſolute commenda intermedia diuturna temporalis vel ad certum temporis ſpatium limitata commenda perſon life abſolutely ſo long ſhall biſhop ſuch place like degree commendams doth refer commendam obtinere capere apprehendere diſpenſation commendam recipere ſhall make title ought three incident 1 ought recipere convertere uſus proprios 2 ought ad utilitatem eccleſiae vel parſonae 3 ought aſſent patron mere commendatarius accountable ordinary vid caſe evans aſcough latch rep commendam retinere truth commendam though commonly ſo called faculty retention continuation benefice ſame perſon ſtate wherein notwithſtanding ſomething intervening biſhoprick like without ſuch faculty would avoided 4 semeſtral commendatary reputed praelatus procurator adminiſtrator habens titulum canonicum doth make fructus ſuos ad providendum ſibi miniſtris remains converted uſe church greg x concil lugd 1275 gloſs cap nemo 15 de electione sexto john datbon 1248 upon othobous canon conſtitution de commendis eccleſiarum ſays commendare idem eſt quod deponere ſeu cuſtodiae committere agree ſuch commendatary praelatus procurator habet tamen legitimam adminiſtrationem ad colligend providend miniſtris ea vero quae ſuperſunt ad utilitatem eccleſiae convertenda commendare ut ait papin nihil aliud eſt quam deponere l lucius ff depoſit l commendare ff de verb sig l publia ff depoſit gloſs ibid perpetual commendam perpetuity diſpoſal fruit muſt concur gomez regul de trien poſſ patron cannot preſent church full ſo neither commendam made church certain full difference betwixt commendam preſentation one preſents parſon church commits church parſon incompatible church hath proper rector canon alſo ſpeaking commendams rely much upon eccleſias vacantes neceſſitatem utilitatem eccleſiae vacantis commendams made anciently general term church uncertain ſome certain church void alſo patron conſent neceſſary commendam ſecundum omnes patroni conſenſus omnium qui laedi poſſunt requiritur quod ſatis obſervant praelati qui niſi praeſentati per patronos non faciunt commendas gloſs concil lugd othob provin hob rep dict caſ colt glover verſ biſhop covent lichfield likewiſe aſſerted sir hen hobart caſe aforeſaid temporary commenda brings ſo many incongruity inconvenience abſurdities law cannot born thereby church neither altogether void remains caſe commendam semeſtris sequeſtration fruit cure till patron preſents neither church abſolutely full ſhould plenum conſulta h c plenum de poſſeſſore conſulta de rectore hob ubi ſupr 5 commenda canon law hath nigh affinity collation rebuff § statuimus ver conferantur de collat canonical inſtitution canonical title cap dudum 2 de elect etſi titulum non detur eccleſia commendatary dy benefice void ut alia titulum poſseſsa rebuff de pacif poſſeſs nu 42 43 44 pope wont provide commendam gave benefice cuſtodiam cuſtody thereof ſhould thereof fructus ſuos cap nemo de elect 6 ſhould reſtore ſame placuit 10 q 3 unleſs expreſsd grant often commendatary ſhould convert fruit thereof uſe law provided commendam commendatary ſhall ſaid titularius eccleſiae conceſsae becauſe hath another ſame time together cannot aliam habere titulum cap dudum 2 de elect cap fin 21 q 1 law compare relation rector church man wife expreſs term call matrimonium cap ſicut vir q 1 ſays odious benefice one wife one cap de multa de praebend whence may aptly inferrd plurality kind spiritual bigamy polygamy moreover canon law commendam may either certain time life cap extirpandae § quia vero de praeben c nemo de elect 6 vacancy see chapter may grant commendam ad tempus c ſignificatum de praeb dict c nemo commendam granted perpetuity life vice tituli nam ad tempus collatio fieri nequit beneficii c ſi gratioſe de reſcript c ſatis perverſum 66 diſt church rome certain benefice never wont given commendam ſuch holy ghoſt sicily st john jeruſalem st anthony bleſſed virgin mary others conſtitution pope alexander sixth mark grace becauſe given fraternity theſe order titulum rebuff de commendis nu 41 prox benef 6 whether man inferiour biſhop may eccleſiam commendare queſtion moved rebuffus hold affirmative provided commenda ad tempus six month rebuff reſpon 71 de commenda opinion panormitan ſeems ſaying inferiorem à papa non poſſe perpetuo commendare ſed ad tempus ſic panorm c ſi conſtiterit 1 notab de accuſat canoniſts romiſh church hold commendare perpetuum poteſt ſolus papa ad tempus ſex menſium quilibet ordinarius poteſt likewiſe panormitan ſays chapter sede vacante poſſit uſque ad ſex menſes commendare panor felin c cum olim 11 q de major obed jo franciſc tract de offic poteſt capituli sede vacante 2 part q 3 whence rebuffus concludes qui beneficia conferre poteſt may like rule law illud videtur permiſſum quod non eſt prohibitum c nam concupiſcentiam de conſti l praecipimus c de appellat canon law beholding cleareſt apprehenſions poſſibly commendams allows extenſive latitude pope granting revoking thereof doth concern u pope eccleſiaſtical power heretofore exerciſed realm way uſurpation veſted king de jure yet agreed hand commendam nature meerly properly cuſtodial church benefice granted commendam quando cuſtodiam ſeu cuſtodiae cauſa datur c nemo de elect 6 hath cuſtody thing non facit fructus ſuos ſo neither according canon law hath commendam without pope ſpecial grant thereof commendatary c placuit 10 q 3 rebuff de commenda yet ſame law poſſit expenſas facere ex reditibus beneficii commendati ſumere ex eo alimenta debita perſolvere ſicut qui titulum habet c 1 de solutio hoc afferit archidiac cap qui plures 21 q 1 7 grand caſe commendam evans kiffin againſt aſcuth two day argued judge noy attorney acutely ſuccinctly reported thus viz treſpaſs dr thornbury dean york choſen biſhop limbrick ireland conſecration confirmation obtained patent large word non obſtante retinere valeat commendam ſaid deanary c fully decretal de praeben dignit c de multa ſaid de multa providentia fuit lateranenſi concilio prohibitum ut nullus diverſas dignitates eccleſiaſticas vel plures eccleſias parochiales reciperet contra sanctorum canonum inſtituta c praeſenti decreto ſtatuimus ut quicunque receperit aliquod beneficium curam habens animarum annexam ſi prius tale beneficium habebat eo ſit ipſo jure privatus ſi forte illud retinere contenderit etiam alio ſpolietur c agrees text decret cauſ 21 q 1 viz duabus eccleſiis clericus conſcribi nullo modo poteſt evident biſhop could law retain benefice within dioceſs without diſpenſation relaxatio juris permit done law prohibited obſerved commenda eſt quaedam proviſio therefore gomez reg de idiomate ſaith commendare eſt providere quod commenda comprehenditur ſub quibuſcunque regulis de proviſione loquentibus canon law conſent patron requiſite benefice given commendam lib 6 decretal c nemo gloſs ſaith ad commendam vacabitur patronus ſi qui alii ex talus commenda laeduntur alſo conſtit othob de commendis ſaid expreſly conſenſus patroni ad commendam requiritur canon law hold theſe commendams prejudicial diver reſpects therefore ſays experientia docet occaſione commendarum cultum divinum minui curam animarum negligi hoſpitalitatem conſuetam debitam non ſervari ruinis aedificia ſupponi c 6 extra cap paſtoris whereas ſaid biſhop unius uxoris vir canoniſts expound ſhall one biſhoprick one cure ſay per commondam bigamia contrahitur eccleſia therefore well reſolved good pious biſhop another benefice offered hold commendam ſaid abſit ut cum sponſa habeam concubinam clearer underſtanding nature difference theſe commendams conſidered commenda eccleſiae nothing elſe commendatio eccleſiae ad cuſtodiam alterius therefore decret cauſ 21 q 1 qui plures gloſs ſaith commendare nihil aliud eſt quam deponere commenda commendatio eccleſiae diver according nature church limitation continuance commenda commenda may church either curatae non curatae may either temporanea viz time certain six month perpetua viz life commendatary church cure may given commendam unleſs upon evident neceſſity benefit church viz ſupply cure till proviſion made ſufficient incumbent therefore council lion provided parochial church ſhould given commendam niſi ex evidenti neceſſitate vel utilitate eccleſiae quod talis commenda ultra ſemeſtris temporis ſpatium non duraret quod ſecus factum fuerit ſit irritum ipſo jure c 6 decretal c nemo benefice without cure may given canon law ſubſiſtence commendatary vel ad menſam ſenſe canoniſts ſay commenda quaſi comedenda quia eccleſiae quae traditur commendam quaſi comeditur devoratur ſuch benefice may properly given perpetuam commendam summa ſummar tit commenda art 1 2 rule canon law come per commendam warner againſt barret hetl rep 23 stat 2 ed 6 c 13 ſetting tithe caſe corn ſet • tithe owner land took corn dammage feaſant▪ declaration ſhewn long corn remained groundtithe corn court good inaſmuch doth appear owner land dammage doth ſhew long corn remained ground uſual courſe ſuch caſes tithe ſet parſon take away due time party ſhall action caſe court man cannot diſtrain shock corn may diſtrain stack dammage feaſant caſe ſhewn long remained ground therefore doth appear damnified ſo tithe clearly ſet parſon may statute action treſpaſs take away meer stranger ſet tithe ſettles property parſon moities parſons ſhall divide themſelvesdict caſ alia nar • latch fo 228 25 noy ſurmized againſt libel tithesheaves pariſhioners charge bind corn sheaf better dividing thereof uſe make sheaf made shock anonymus latch rep 26 caſe touching tithe glebeland reported aforeſaid leonard stile miller ſame reported owen stile mile miſprinted caſe stile parſon ſuggeſt land parcel glebe parſonagetithe glebe ſaid stile lett ſaid glebe twenty four acre mile year rendring thirteen ſhillings four penny rent prohibit caſe tithe paid wray ſaid although parcel glebe yet leaſed tithe ought paid without queſtion may doubt rent reſerved true value land rent ſmall value wherefore tithe ſhall paid alſo reſervation rent pro omnibus exactionibus demandis yet juſtices took regard theſe word godfrey ſaid thoſe word bulſtr 165 166 par • caſe strowd hoskins upon prohibition two point argued four juſtices viz 1 prohibition brought upon statute 2 ed 6 ſtay suit eccleſiaſtical court tithe barrenlands firſt seven year • behooves party brings prohibition prove suggeſtion within six month otherwiſe conſultation ſaid statute grantable 2 conſultation granted reaſon aforeſaid yet party may new prohibition upon ſame libel statute 50 ed 3 doth extend conſultation granted upon nonprobate suggeſtion within six month conſultation granted upon matter suggeſtion ſo chief juſtice declared opinion four juſtices thereupon rule given prohibition ſhould ſtand defendant notwithſtanding ſuch plea aforeſaid barr prohibition may plead chief matter ſaid suggeſtion diſpute ſhall ſeveral conſultations ſaid libel hil 6 car b r land nature barren statute 2 ed 6 doth intend tithe ſhall paid within ſeven year sherington fleetwoods caſe cro par 1 ſuch land meerly barren made good foldage induſtrious mean ſo adjudged paſch 14 tithesbulſtr par 3 marſh sandy land covered salt water ſo time mind graſs known grow profit made late time great coſts charge induſtry tenant ground lately gained sea overflowing repairing making new bank seawall continual repairing ſo converted ſame arable land corn land parſon libel tithe eccleſiaſtical court upon matter thus ſhewed prohibition prayed diſcharged payment tithe ground seven year statute thus made encouragement tenant make improvement land coke chief juſtice reſolved one farringtons caſe upon statute 2 ed 6 woodground barren ground within statute adjudged one ſtock grub woodground convert arable ground hath meliorated land great coſt labour yet ſhall pay tithe ground preſently heath barrenground intended within statute ought ſuch land ſuapte natura ſterilis barren dederidge juſtice salt marſh fenced ſo made good meadow ſhall pay tithe preſently yet ſo fenced tithe thereof payable coke land ſhall statute clauſe diſcharge seven year notwithſtanding charge tenant hath gaining land sea land within clauſe diſcharge within statute ought suapte natura barren accident overflowing sea whole court agreed statute barren ground ſuch ground bear corn ſelf without great coſt extraordinary manuring therefore ſuch barren ground within statute ought diſcharged payment tithe tithe ought paid fame parſon juſt cauſe ſue tithe eccleſiaſtical court therefore prohibition point hand grotius ſame place si lex humana conjugia inter certas perſonas contrahi prohibeat non ideo ſequitur irritum fore matrimonium ſi ipſa contrabatur ſunt enim diverſa prohibere irritum quid caſu legis paenalis word theſe viz rex qui eſt auctor legis ubi regni ipſius perſonam auctoritatem ſuſtinet qua talis eſt poteſt legem etiam totam tollere quia legis humanae natura eſt ut à voluntate humana pendeat non origine tantum ſed duratione sicut autem totam legem tollere poteſt ita vinculum ejus circa perſonam aut factum ſingulare manente de caetero lege dei ipſius exemplo qui lactantio teſte legem cum poneret non uti que ademit ſibi omnem poteſtatem ſed habet ignoſcendi licentiam imperatori inquit auguſtinus licet revocare ſententiam reum mortis abſolvere ipſi ignoſcere cauſam explicat quia non eſt subjectus legibus qui habet poteſtate leges ferre grot ibid de paenis cap 20 sect 24 farr power prince may extend ſelf matter u clear ſuch acknowledge regal supremacy withall reſpect place one violates priviledges immunity church churchyard 3 reſpect thing thing sacred conſecrated deputed dedicated ſome sacred uſe uſurped upon taken away hold true whether auferatur sacrum de loco ſacro vel non ſacro vel non ſacrum de ſacro lindw de offic archipreſ c 1 gloſ verb sacrilegium 2 sacriledge taken either ſtrictly properly thing ſacred ſtolen ſacred place ſo held according law generally either amount sacriledge according canon large ſenſe improperly ſo extends crime l ſi quis c de epiſ cle c de ſacrileg per totum infringing church liberty invading eccleſiaſtical good like whereof hereafter lindw de immun eccl c 2 gloſ ver sacrilegi emperor held conſtitutions ſo ſacred called violation thereof sacriledge l un c de crimi sacril crime mixt cognizance partly eccleſiaſtica à simone illo mago deducta qui donum spiritus sancti pecuniis emi pura vit viz injuſtum eſt illa vendere quae gratis diſtribui debent simony perſon preſented collated benefice cure soul dignity prebend living eccleſiaſtical c hath ſuch given beſtowed reſpect sum money reward payment gift profit benefit directly indirectly reaſon promiſe agreement grant bond covenant aſſurance sum money reward payment gift profit benefit whatſoever directly indirectly reſpect ſuch corrupt cauſe conſideration every preſentation collation gift alſo every admiſſion inveſture induction thereupon statute utterly voidstat 31 eliz c 6 whereby king heir succeſſors one turn ſhall preſent collate c every perſon ſo giving taking ſuch sum money c taking making ſuch promiſe c doth forfeit loſe double value one year profit every ſuch benefice moreover perſon ſo corruptly taking ſuch benefice thereupon thenceforth adjudged perſon diſabled law hold enjoy ſame beneficestat ibid like penalty ſaid double value doth incurr sum money reward c directly indirectly lawful fee reaſon promiſe c doth admit inſtitute inſtall induct perſon benefice cure c likewiſe incumbent ſuch benefice ſhall corruptly reſign exchange ſame reſpect thereof ſhall corruptly take directly indirectly penſion ſum money benefit whatever ſuch caſe giver taker corruptly aforeſaid ſhall forfeit double value ſum ſo given taken habeas corpus williams juſtice taken force capis de excommunicato capiendo bailable upon statute 5 eliz cap 23 statute doth diſpenſe forfeiture ten pound ſuch perſon bailable matter ſame remains common law statute 5 eliz diſpenſeth penalty ten pound yelverton juſtice contrary opinion caſe bailable flemming chief juſtice caſe doth deſerve good conſideration therefore would conſider well alſo statute 5 eliz would deliver opinion williams juſtice clearly bailable caſe afterwards another time moved unto court bailed yelverton juſtice bailable ſo reſolved one keyſers caſe taken writ de excommunicato capiendo brought hither habeas corpus upon cauſe ſhewed bailed court de die diem neither sheriff juſtice peace countrey bail ſuch one court may well bail caſe de die diem alledged alſo reaſon thereof two ſeveral form writ theſe two caſes writ returnable pleaſure party ſues ſamefinch nomotexnia p 138 may returned court common plea well king bench deprived high commiſſioners conforming canon church general quia refractarius particular canon mentioned king reaſon ſaid deprivation preſented b inducted would yield poſſeſſion parſonagehouſe whereupon writ vi laica iſſued chancery sheriff came houſe could apprehend party b finding houſe empty entered peaceably made affidavit b r ouſted sheriff force b put poſſeſſion court b r thereupon granted writ reſtitution appeal
